intro: Capsella bursa-pastoris latisiliqua, commonly known as the greater shepherd's purse, is an annual herbaceous plant belonging to the Brassicaceae family. It is characterized by its distinctive triangular seed pods, which resemble a purse, hence its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 20–60 cm, with alternate, lobed leaves that are hairy and serrated. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in racemes, and it blooms from spring to early summer.
